compare.abroad.column.Margin_(_of_loan_amount)Amount_to_paid_by_students_own_pocket 10%Includes scholarship/assistantshipTo be provided yearly or at first disbursement on a pro-rata basis Up to ₹4 lakh: No margin₹4–7.5 lakh: 15%Above ₹7.5–150 lakh: 10% (medical & other courses) ₹7.5–40 lakh: 15% ₹40–150 lakh: No fixed marginIf 100% collateral offered: Margin = NIL; processing fee ₹10,000Otherwise: 15% margin + minimum 50% collateralNotes: Collateral based on principal + interest; scholarships count as margin and must be deposited in bank Up to ₹4 lakh: NILAbove ₹4 lakh: 15%Includes scholarship/assistantshipTo be brought in yearly or with disbursements on pro-rata basis Premier Institutions & EDP:Up to ₹4 lakh: NILAbove ₹4 lakh and up to ₹7.5 lakh: 15%Above ₹7.5 lakh: NILNon-Premier Institutions:Up to ₹4 lakh: NILAbove ₹4 lakh and up to ₹7.5 lakh: 15%Above ₹7.5 lakh: 10% 10%Includes scholarship/assistantshipTo be brought in yearly or with disbursements on pro-rata basis.visible

compare.abroad.column.Insurance Insurance of property is mandatory in case of mortgage of property All the student borrowers are offered a specially designed OPTIONAL Term Insurance cover and the premium can be included as an item of finance. Term life insurance policy to be obtained & assigned in favour of the bank.The policy should be in the name of student, for an amount not less than the loan amount and for the tenure covering course, moratorium and repayment periodThe premium of insurance can be included in the loan amount, if requested by the student Not disclosed Group credit Life Insurance Cover will be mandatory if Loan amount exceeds Rs.7.50 Lakh.The Cost of Insurance Premium may be financed by Bank by adding the same in the project cost and shall be recovered along with EMIs of the loan. Alternatively, student can provide any term insurance plan obtained from any IRDA approved insurance Company. Not disclosed.visible

compare.abroad.column.Collateral_Docs  Collateral free loan upto ₹ 50 lakh along with Co-obligation of parents/guardian is offered to select top Global Institutions. For Secured loan: Co-obligation of parents/ guardianstogether with tangible collateral security of suitable value. The assignment of future income of the student for payment of instalments. The security can be in the form of land/ building/ Govt.Securities/ Bonds issued by PSUs/ Units of UTI, NSC, KVP,LIC policy, gold, shares/debentures, Bank Deposit in thename of student/ parent/ guardian/ any other third party andsuch other tangible liquid securities as may be deemedappropriate by the sanctioning authority. Collateral security offered by Third Party (other than parents) can also be accepted. The co-obligator should be parent(s)/guardian of the student borrower. In case of married person, co-obligationCopy of Sale Deed and other documents of title to property in respect of immovable property offered as collateral security / Photocopy of Liquid Security offered as collateralAt the time of Documentation, all original property documents are required to be submitted, in case of mortgage of property Collateral security details and documents , if any Common documents:Registered sale deedApproved plan or map of the constructed property.Chain documents.Latest property tax receipt.Occupancy proof.
